title: The Author Page of a Cute Fish
content:
[[include :cutefishsite:pastel-one]]

[[/>]]

[[=]]

[[div style="display: inline-block; border:solid 1px #312e54; background:#fff; float:top; width:75%; padding:10px 20px; margin:10px 20px"]]
[[<]]
[[include component:image-block-peppo
| name=http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/local--files/the-author-page-of-a-cute-fish/fish.png
| caption=This is not a picture of Dr. Cho; this is a picture of a very cute fish. Dr. Cho is temporary; cuteness is eternal.
| width=300px]]

**Name:** Seojin (Sam) Cho

**Personnel ID:** 4582915

**Security Clearance:** 6/RAISA

**Position:** Anomalous Records Archivist
 
**Location:** Site-126, [REDACTED]

**Associated SWN001-1 Entity:** [[*user cutefish]]

**Profile:** --Moved to Site-126 2018. Origin is as of yet unknown. It is constructed from flesh and bone with traces of polyester and cotton. Dr. Cho is animate but not very hostile. The object cannot move while within a direct line of sight. Line of sight must not be broken at any time with Dr. Cho. Personnel assigned to enter office are instructed to alert one another before blinking. Object is reported to attack by hugging the body around the torso, or by strangulation. In the event of an attack, personnel are to observe Class 4 hazardous personnel containment procedures.--

--Personnel report sounds of incoherent monologuing originating from within the office when no one is present inside. This is considered normal, and any change in this behaviour should be reported to the acting HMCL supervisor on duty.--

--The black and gray substance on the floor is a combination of hair and dust. Origin of these materials is unknown. The room should have been cleaned on a bi-weekly basis.--

Employed by the Foundation on January 9th, ████, after an incident involving an uncontained anomaly.

Dr. Cho has moved to RAISA on June 30th, 2018, after working as a researcher in the Infohazard Department for over █ years. Specialized in anomalous information handling, Dr. Cho's primary job is to contain and catalogue anomalous data and records. Being a member of [REDACTED], most information about Dr. Cho's current status is classified under Level 6/RAISA clearance.
[[/<]]
[[/div]]
